criterion: Provides a clear explanation of the relationship between sitting for long periods and lower back pain.
Mentions that sharp pain or difficulty walking, lifting, or bending could indicate a more serious issue.
Asks the user about their specific job duties to better understand their work constraints.
Uses natural language and avoids technical jargon.
Suggests simple stretches or posture adjustments as a first step, without implying a need for extensive medical evaluation.
Fails to address the user's concern about potential long-term damage or underlying conditions.
Incorrectly states that only severe pain requires medical attention.
Advises the user to seek medical attention without providing any clear guidance on how to do so.
Provides a balanced view of the trade-off between job demands and self-care.
Lacks clear guidance on when to seek medical attention.
